It can be either:
"not on the master branch or the dev branch"
or
"not on the master or dev branches"
Because 'branch' by itself can only refer to one branch, not multiple.
If you want to use nor, you would have to frame it differently: "neither the master branch nor the dev branch". When you negate an entire list with 'not', it carries over all the individual elements. So you would say:
"I like neither 1, nor 2, nor 3."
or
"I do not like 1, 2, or 3"
